channel.title: How to code a npc in a certain area?
channel.description:
ok wtf i code a npc in a certain area and it wont work it fucks up and it says this in the run_server.bat
[code]Buildfile: build.xml
runserver: [java] Fucked Npc: <id>477</id><startX>365</startX><startY>3353</startY> [java] Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: n must be positive [java] at java.util.Random.nextInt(Unknown Source) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.util.DataConversions.random(DataConversi ons.java:283) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.model.Npc.updatePosition(Npc.java:227) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater.updateNpcPositions(ClientU pdater.java:60) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.ClientUpdater.updateClients(ClientUpdate r.java:31) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.GameEngine.processClients(GameEngine.jav a:150) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.GameEngine.run(GameEngine.java:83)[/code]

item.title: How to code a npc in a certain area?
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Rather obvious when you look at it:

Fucked Npc: <id>477</id><startX>365</startX><startY>3353</startY>

Fix the coordinates.

Read full topic

item.title: How to code a npc in a certain area?
item.dc:creator: @Johnisriot Johnisriot
item.description:
@Johnisriot wrote:

Why in the hell are you even going to bother? You’ll fuck up your bat or end up setting the wrong path and close the server down in less than a week again lol.
